## Load packages

```{r}
library(data.table)
library(plyr)
library(dplyr)
library(magrittr)
library(lubridate)
library(readr)
library(survival)
library(Epi)
library(emmeans)
library(ggplot2)
#library(ckbplotr)
library(rms)
library(timeROC)
library(riskRegression)
```

```{r}
source("rounding_functions.R")
source("cut_by_quantile.R")
```

## Load data

```{r}
dat <- fread("prepped_risk.csv", data.table = FALSE)
```


Create a follow-up in years 
```{r}
dat <- mutate(dat, fu_time_years = as.numeric(fu_time/365.25))
```

Model needs to be limited to 5 years of follow-up
```{r}
temp <- survSplit(Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ ., data = dat, cut = 5, episode="epoch")
dat5 <- subset(temp, epoch == 1)  
```

## Run models

```{r}
# Age only
model_1 <- mfp(Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ fp(age_entry_years)+sex+smoking+fp(BMI)+fp(med_steps)+fp(CadencePeak30Adjusted.steps.min.)+fp(med_steps*CadencePeak30Adjusted.steps.min.), family=cox, data=dat5, select=0.05, verbose=TRUE)
summary(model_1)
vif(model_1)



# Age and sex
model_2 <- coxph(Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ age_entry_years+sex, dat5)

# Age, sex and smoking
model_3 <- coxph(Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ age_entry_years+sex+smoking, dat5)

# Age, sex, smoking and BMI
model_4 <- coxph(Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ age_entry_years+sex+smoking+BMI, dat5,x=TRUE,y=TRUE)
summary (model_4)

# Age, sex, smoking and steps
model_5 <- coxph(Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ age_entry_years+sex+smoking+BMI+med_steps, dat5,x=TRUE,y=TRUE)

a1 <- pec::cindex(list("Cox no steps"=model_4,"Cox with steps"=model_5), formula=Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ age_entry_years+sex+smoking+BMI+med_steps, data=dat5)
summary(a1)
a2 <- riskRegression::Score(list("Cox no steps"=model_4,"Cox with steps"=model_5), formula=Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ age_entry_years+sex+smoking+BMI+med_steps, data=dat5)

# Age, sex, smoking, steps and cadence
model_6 <- coxph(Surv(fu_time_years, RA_incident) ~ age_entry_years+sex+smoking+BMI+med_steps+CadencePeak30Adjusted.steps.min., dat5)

```
